sen.j: 宇都宮 三郎（うつのみや さぶろう、1834年11月15日（天保5年10月15日 (旧暦)） - 1902年（明治35年）7月23日）は幕末・明治初期の軍学者、技術者である。
sen.e: Saburo UTSUNOMIYA (November 15, 1834 - July 23, 1902) is a known scholar of military science and an engineer, who played an active role through the end of Edo Period and to the early Meiji Period.
Saburo UTSUNOMIYA (November 15, 1834 - July 23, 1902) is a scholar of military science and an engineer, who played an active role from the end of Edo Period to the early Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: ・knownは特に原文に書かれていないので削除しました。・「幕末・明治初期の」の部分は、and を削除しfrom/toで表現しました。
sen.e: Saburo UTSUNOMIYA (November 15, 1834 - July 23, 1902) is a scholar of military science and an engineer, who played an active role from the end of Edo Period to the early Meiji Period.

sen.j: 尾張藩の子として名古屋に生まれ、甲州流軍学を学んだ。
sen.e: UTSUNOMIYA was born in Nagoya as the son of a feudal retainer of Owari Domain; as he grew up, he studied Koshu-ryu Gungaku. (the military strategy theory of Koshu region, based on the military strategy of Takeda clan who had once dominated this region with strong military power)
sen.cmt: 尾張藩の子という文章は尾張藩士の子という意味だと思われます。そのように訳しました。

sen.cmt: ・ピリオドを（）の後に移動させました。

sen.j: その後、西洋砲術を学び、幕府の蕃書調所などに務めた。
sen.e: Later he studied Western gunnery, and he worked at the library of Western books of Edo bakufu.
Later he studied Western gunnery, and he worked at Bansho shirabesho of Edo bakufu or the Institute for the investigation of Western books.
sen.cmt: ・「蕃書調所」は、用語集を参考に追加修正しました。

sen.j: 「化学」という言葉も宇都宮が提唱したという。
sen.e: It is considered the word "Kagaku" (which literally means the study of alteration and transformation, referring to chemical science) was invented by UTSUNOMIYA.
It is considered the word "Kagaku" (which literally means chemistry) was invented by UTSUNOMIYA.
sen.cmt: ・化学の英訳の説明を短縮しました。

sen.j: 維新後は開成学校教官や明治政府の技官（工部省・農商務省 (日本)）となった。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, he worked as an instructor at Kaisei Gakko, (Kaisei School) and also as the gikan (bureaucrat with specialized skills; he worked at Kobusho, the Ministry of Industry and No-Shomusho, the Agriculture and Commerce Ministry) of Meiji government.

sen.j: この間、セメント、炭酸ソーダ、耐火煉瓦の製造などに当たった。
sen.e: While he was in those positions, he developed the manufacturing process of cement, sodium carbonate, and fire-proof bricks.

sen.j: 日本で初めて生命保険に加入したと言われる。
sen.e: He was the first person who became the member of a life insurance in Japan.
It is said that he was the first person who bought life insurance in Japan.
